conbody.p: Reprocessor stream handles the records that have been rejected by the Business logic stream. To avoid filling up the database with rejected records, the Reprocessor stream automatically transfers these records to a specified SFTP server. After the reason for rejection has been identified and fixed, rejected records can be reprocessed, that is, passed to the Business logic stream again. When reprocessing is triggered, the Reprocessor stream transfers rejected records from the SFTP server back to the database. Once the records have been put back into the database, they will be automatically processed by Business logic stream.

The Reprocessor stream consists of two nodes: CG Rejection Collector Node and CG Rejection Distributor Node. CG Rejection Distributor Node transfers rejected records from the database to the SFTP server. The transfer is executed automatically whenever the stream is running. CG Rejection Collector Node brings rejected records from the SFTP server to the database, where they are processed again. It starts the transfer only when the node execution is scheduled.
